message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a machine learning-based algorithm for providing individual recourse in decision-making systems, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the fairness of decision-making systems, which could fall under the category of cybersecurity and privacy (cs.CR) or social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper proposes an alternative approach to generating counterfactual explanations, which could fall under the category of computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV) or human-computer interaction (cs.HC). However, since the paper primarily focuses on machine learning and decision-making systems, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely categories.
